lines: “Continued emission of greenhouse gases will cause further warming and long-lasting changes in all components of the climate system, increasing the likelihood of severe, pervasive and irreversible impacts for people and ecosystems.”
We have located and interviewed people around the world already affected by the effects of climate change.
They have shared their observations and experiences of these effects at their local level, as well as their communities' perspectives on adaptations.

This exhibition compiles these individual testimonies and combines them with factual information - ecological, legal and economic. This montage of local and global foci invites reflection on the severity and complexity of climate change.
Voluntarily delocalized, the exhibition is accessible online for one year. It will be fed with new testimonies, which expose various regional situations and strategies of adaptation.
Together, these testimonies invite us to reflect on the responsibilities we share as inhabitants of the Earth.
